item.title: Padding Oracle Attack
item.description: This post is an effort to explain the padding oracle attack for Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) mode of encryption. In a successful attack, an attacker can recover the plaintext without any knowledge of the key. If the application, which is handling the decryption, leaks information about the valid and invalid padding, an attacker can send specially crafted ciphertext blocks and recover the plaintext.
